By danz on Wednesday, February 20, 2002 - 08:52 pm:

By Eagle Fierce on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 02:45 am:

Eagle is my old high-school nickname, because I always had the fighting spirit and need for freedom. The Eagle and the Fox are my spirit animals. I used to use the analogy that we are all special animals, and was teased by the bullies about being shot down.

Fierce is actually my last name. Grimm translated to Enlish = Fierce. Fierce was a title once given to the equivalent of a "knight" back in the days of the nomadic tribes.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 02:53 am:

Kurasu Soratobu is Japanese.

Kurasu=Class
Soratobu=To Fly In The Sky

Which makes me: class flying in the sky?

Ok, the reason behind this is a misspelling and mistranslation: I wrote a character for a fanfic that I wanted to name 'Raven'. Raven (or crow) in Japanese is 'Karasu'. Due to a friend's mistranslation, it was rendered 'Kurasu'. And by the time I got corrected, I was known more as 'Kurasu' than my real name. So it stuck. :)

By torey_luvullo on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 06:41 am:

torey luvullo is another misspelling...that of a journeyman utility infielder who began his career as a detroit tiger, then played for the rangers, yankees and indians, before ending his career in japan.

By Tigerbubble on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 10:46 am:

Tigerbubble is my little way of saying Galum, which is the water-going sub-breed of Tiger. A Galum is a Tiger that lives in the ocean, and all monsters in the ocean make bubbles.
The reason i initially chose a Tiger (rather than just saying galum or galumbubble) was because it reminds me of my late dog (Benson), and is nearly the namesake of my still living cat (Tigger). So it only seemed right to stick with a Tiger.

PS: i'm not really sure why Tigers remind me of my late dog, since he was a Bichon Frise, maybe it's just the canine thing.

By Corpse on Thursday, February 21, 2002 - 12:43 pm:

I chose my handle "Corpse" for three reasons. One, it's the street name I'd be known by, if I still hung with some certain friends of mine. Two, it's been my rancher name since MR1. Three, the idea came to me when I bought a copy of Resident Evil 2 (brand new at the time) for only $6.66 off a friends little brother. (Don't ask how I got the idea to start using my online name Corpse outta this; even I haven't figured that out yet)

By Khift on Wednesday, March 20, 2002 - 04:34 pm:

I've gone by too many names, none of which had any real inspiration.

Originally I went by paj363, which is still my Hotmail address. Then wehn I joined Uo, I needed a good name for a fighter, so I named myself Jack Varukisas. When I made the name, I didn't realize it ended in 'kisas', which, sadly, sounds like something that a bad student might do in order to raise their grades. After my friend pointed that out, I panicked and wanted a new name. After looking through some of my MtG (Magic the Gathering) cards, I saw a card that I liked alot - Aether Flash. I liked Aether, so I dubbed myself Aetheri. After a while at Gamefaqs, I got tired of that name and wanted yet another new one. So I made Khift. I've stuck with it for almost half a year now, so it should stay permanently.

By Monster Fenrick on Tuesday, May 14, 2002 - 07:20 am:

LOL.. Torey's Logic..

Mosnter Fenrick:

Originally Fenrick was my First RPG (D&D) Character name. he was the Dashing Elf (Fighter / Mage). I played him as an over charismatic Han-solo.

Most of my "Serious, hardcore" D&D friends thought this was outrageously funny.. and so started actually calling me "Fenrick". it became a nickname, and so when I got my first computer with e-mail addresses they became Fenrick so my friends could remember.

Monster came into play as I started getting online with the Mosnter Rancher stuff... and so was evolved into the Main/Sub of Monster Fenrick.

(of course i am still named Frendric, frankie, fendrik amongst many many other misspellings.. i didn't realize it was that hard to spell)

By Djinnmastr on Tuesday, May 14, 2002 - 10:16 pm:

Djinnmastr is a combination of Djinn, which is from Magic: The Gathering, and Master, which is a person who is in charge of something. Back in the day, when i played MTG, Djinn's were insanely powerful cards that had a tendancy to damage their owners. Another card similar to Djinn was Efreet, and, although i'm not sure, i think Djinns are Genies and Efreets are Ifrits (Like in Final Fantasy, i dunno the mythological meaning) So why do i still use this name even though i don't play M:TG, and why do i use it without an "E" in Mastr? Because I signed up for AOL many years ago, back when there was a 10 character limit on the names, and I never wanted to change it, since this is what people knew me as. Its that simple

By phatlad on Monday, July 29, 2002 - 07:54 am:

My nickname comes like this. Although know one calls me "phatlad" (everyone calls me bigdaddy), here's how I got fatlad.
My friends and I were playing a golf game on sega, and you could only have six characters maximum to enter your name.
I have what you would call a weight problem, and I tend to poke fun of myself a lot (all in good humor, I'm a funny guy). So, I chose the largest golfer of the bunch and put the name "fatlad" as his name.
Anywho, about a year later, the "ph" craze swept the nation (around the time of the atlanta olympics, I believe). I was getting into online stuff and set up a yahoo! email account, and fatlad already was taken so I chose "phatlad" to be funny. (my friends and I always prounced the ph on purpose to be funny, like the p-hat farm, instead of the fat farm. I know, we're so crazy!)
Since then, I've just kept it for every thing I've joined online. either that or the alternate "phatladok" for oklahoma.

By GoldenBoy on Friday, January 24, 2003 - 03:13 pm:

All the Young'uns in chat ask if it's Golden Boy "from the anime?" and I say no.

For me Golden Boy is the name of one of my best heroes from the Champions Superhero RPG (though I'm sure Thorr will contest the "best" par). Simply imagine a 6' 8" Oscar statue, without a sword, and you have a good handle on GB. GB has been converted into a Rifts Earth version as well, so I could use him for a friend's campaign.

GB isn't a genius, unless you ask him about comic books, kick boxing, or being a hero, but he gets by. He's managed to become one of the government's "top men" simply by being reliable and personable, and capable of stopping artillery shells with his chest and lifting a tank. He's an all-round good guy and a lot of fun to roleplay.

By Daeore Dermegil on Wednesday, March 5, 2003 - 01:49 pm:

My first nickname was from a character I made for 'Vampire-Dark Ages' Ly'fandes. (say the name slow, you'll get the joke)

Next, a few years later, I was still into the whole vampire game thing, and made this name. Daeore Dermegil. I had a book of 'English to Elvish; (by J.R.R. Tolkein)
Dae = Shadow
Ore = Heart
Der = Dark
Megil = Sword

The end result was Daeore Dermegil. (said: Day'or'eh Der'me'guile )

I've always been a sword freak. I have a nice little collection already too. So, I really liked this name. Sounded good on and off paper.

I even wrote fanfiction (sailor moon, I know I know no stones please) with him in it. And have used the name ever since.

By Trousle on Sunday, September 28, 2003 - 12:31 pm:

My full online name is Trousle Undrhil. I picked Trousle because it's a mispelling of Trouble. Don't ask why I was going to use Trouble Undrhil for a name ... cause I wasn't. =) Trousle just sounded cool. And, no ... I didn't get Undrhil from The Lord of the Rings. I never even read the trilogy until someone asked me if that was where I got my name. I actually got the name Undrhil from the name of the street I used to live on in Orlando, FL (Lake Underhill Rd.) I originally was using Underhill, but when I tried to get the name on AOL once, it was being used, so I shortened it to Undrhil and I haven't changed it back. =)

Trousle

By Hellraiser83 on Sunday, November 23, 2003 - 02:47 pm:

Fun fun fun.

Well, tracing real far back I was once known as Weirdo1983. I was weird and my birthyear is 1983. I then got interesting in nwn (the old aol freeware version) and changed to DL Ambush (a combination of my DragonLord guild and Ambush, my soccer team). Now it starts getting relevant. A friend got me into gundam wing. By far my favorite gundam was Deathscythe. It had a special version called Deathscythe-Hell. Said friend gets me into an aol chatroom RPG, but I have to change my name to something related to the gundam I want to play. Hellscythe sounds good. It's taken, so I add 83 to it. There's Hellscythe83. I ended up never playing the game, but the aol account stuck ^_^; Now comes the old m-r.com board. I need a name. I was going to just use Hellscythe83, but then my brother suggests that since I'm going to be ranching I should change it to raiser. Bam, Hellraiser83 is born. I spent a brief time as CPraiser83, but this name is definitely going to stick.

By Endless Vision on Monday, November 24, 2003 - 06:47 pm:

I picked Endless Vision because when my parents were in the midst of getting divorced, all I heard was fighting and screaming and I couldn't take it anymore. By Harrabcat on Monday, December 1, 2003 - 10:07 pm:

Arge My way of creating names is very very off but here goes.. twas a night before christmas... wait wrong story... ok Twas a night in the classroom in about 4th or 5th grade.. darn was i really bored back then.. anyways we was doing one of those boring things 'ok class line up according to name to get picture taken' being a nelson i got stuck in the middle so i devised a plan... I was gonna make up a name that would get me to the front of the line... how... lets see think of an animals name that starts with an early letter... armadillo... Abcarmadillo... too cheesy... cow?? abcow... eh... bunny... abcbunny... sounds like something off sesame street... cat... abcat... hey... hey!! we hit gold.... ok dat was then that name sticks in my mind not really a nickname just i name i can use.. ok har.. gee back way back when.. i was playing a cruddy old MMPORPG... I needed a name... well what would a barbarian be called... (thinking caveman) har....groth... hey that has a ring to it... hargroth want food... food for hargroth... so im thinking ok thats my name... well everybody called my har with all the name shortening... so i made a character named har then stuck... added another r... came here... hm.. lets see what happens if i add them together... GASP!!!!!! Harrabcat... that has a ring to it... there my name!! And i told the story using 50 to many periods...

By MangleBoP on Tuesday, March 9, 2004 - 06:35 pm:

Ok,buckle up, it's going to be a bumpy ride!
So my best friend has been playing HalfLife online and is part of a clan called the Brotherhood of Pain{BoP}. Then he and his buddies start using their clan names for other stuff. We join a medevil renenactment group called DagorHir.
My friend wants to start his own faction{BoP}. I want to join said faction, and need a name. So my other friend suggests Mangle because of my vicious, unrelenting style of fighting.

Mangle: verb, to crush, maul, grind, or cut roughly and repeatedly; to fold laundry[see horror film "The Mangler"]

So then we start making up ideas as to what our charecters are.
Body Count: Demon,possesing the body of another charecter.
Twist: Wraith, likes to destroy people's minds. Plague: Unknown.
Mangle: Unspeakable Horror, built out of parts still twitching after large inter-species conflict.

I have also gone by Zyko{psyko} and Coyote, but will not be using the name Coyote anymore because one of my new friend's real name is Coyote Laughs At The Devil.

I too consider myself something of a Goth, but get sick of the pretentious trendy bull$#!+ that Goths must always be gloomy,pale,bored-with-everything,elitist snobs. That steriotype died with those stupid punks in Columbine, who ruined Goth for the rest of us!

I live in Florida,and am Multi-Ethnic, a deathly palor does not come naturally to me.The local Goths would not acept me as one of their's, so I took on a sort of Grunge/Goth look, it works for me.

Coyote, BTW, introduced me to Voltaire's music and it rocks!

P.S. Ender, I thought that was where you got that name!
